meanings.definition: The quality of being graceful and stylish in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: Her elegance on the dance floor captivated everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The ballerina moved with such elegance and grace.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled with surprising elegance, almost like a little dancer.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with the elegance of a master artist.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion exuded an air of elegance and sophistication.

meanings.definition: Refinement and simplicity in design or style.
meanings.sent1: The simplicity and elegance of the dress made it perfect for the occasion.
meanings.sent2: The room was decorated with a touch of elegance and refinement.
meanings.sent3: The cat's elegant leap onto the table was both graceful and unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The black and white color scheme added an air of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef's plating showed great attention to detail and elegance.

meanings.definition: The quality of being pleasingly ingenious and simple.
meanings.sent1: The elegance of the solution lay in its simplicity and effectiveness.
meanings.sent2: The design of the new gadget combined elegance with practicality.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's method of cracking nuts showed a surprising elegance of technique.
meanings.sent4: The writer's words flowed with an elegance that was both captivating and clear.
meanings.sent5: The garden was arranged with an elegance that made it a peaceful retreat.
